alert.note: Alert for Anson; Cumberland; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 30 at 2:47PM EDT until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Chatham, Cumberland, Durham, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Harnett, Hoke, Johnston, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Nash, Orange, Richmond, Sampson, Scotland, Stanly, Wake, Wayne and Wilson. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Flooding from Tropical Cyclone Idalia is possible across southern and eastern portions of central North Carolina tonight through Thursday evening. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible, with local amounts to 7 inches. http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
